author: odyslam
content: I think it's better if you make a PR in the GH repo as <@!364458974906548225> mentioned above. You can create your own .md file in the /notes file and add freely your content

author: odyslam
content: For anyone who is interested in MEV/layer2, I have added some resources (articles, podcasts, papers) in my notes file. You will find them in notes/odysseas.md: https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-zero/blob/main/notes/odysseas.md

author: peter.davies
content: Hi, I'm Peter. I'm currently living in Birmingham, UK (not Alabama). Have a degree in Mathematics. I've spent a lot of time thinking about elliptic curves in a non cryptographic context. I've been lurking it cryptocurrency communities for ages, but never really gotten involved. Very interested in the opportunity to do core protocol R&D for Ethereum. Have been thinking recently about whether it would be feasible to use threshold decryption to prevent validators from knowing the contents of transactions before they include them in blocks to prevent MEV.

author: schattian
content: Hi everyone. I'm Sebastian from Argentina.  Currently, I work as a  software engineer at Amazon, Ring. I started learning about blockchain at the beginning of the year, and couldn't stopped until now. I'm passionate about standardization and simplicity, so I found this place to be the best one to put my efforts.

author: potuz
content: Hi, also a mathematician here, and interestingly enough my last article has the words "elliptic curves" in the title. I  have been discussing with colleagues precisely this problem of threshold decryption. In the contexts of sidechains running on Cartesi for example that allows you to run Linux. We ran into problems that seemed unsolvable for DOS attacks and the such.

author: greg_vardy
content:
Hey Peter, I'm in Cambridge UK and I also studied Mathematics! I'm super interested in working on zk-SNARKs & the EVM, it could also be used to prevent validators knowing contents of transactions before they include them in a block, although its currently not feasible because it's too slow. I'm actually currently writing up a super long blog post series that goes extremely deep on zk-SNARKs.

I'm not sure fully preventing MEV is possible, trying to prevent it could/would result in MEV happening in private instead of the open, hence why Flashbots exists (I've been part of the flashbots community for a while). And in the context of ETH2 some MEV might actually help make the network more secure by attracting more validators/capital.
